basics.name: John Walley
basics.label: Software Developer
basics.summary: Full-stack developer and entrepreneur with over 15 years of experience delivering robust applications and innovative software solutions. Expert in TypeScript, JavaScript, and data visualisation, with a proven track record of leading cross-industry projects from conception to deployment.

work.name: Mulberry House Software
work.summary: Founded and grew a software consultancy delivering innovative solutions across multiple industries.
highlights: Developed a floor planner in collaboration with [Reno](https://www.renovatewithreno.co.uk/), a leading UK home renovation startup.
Designed visualization tools for the pension industry in partnership with [Financial Canvas](https://www.financialcanvas.co.uk/).

Created open-source data visualization libraries with over 80,000 weekly downloads ([Allotment](https://allotment.mulberryhousesoftware.com/) & [Pennant](https://pennant.vega.xyz/)) for [Vega](https://vega.xyz/), a decentralized derivatives trading network.

work.name: Redgate
work.summary: Enhanced product visibility and usage for a newly acquired database deployment tool.
highlights: Increased awareness and adoption through targeted marketing and outreach strategies.
Implemented in-product analytics to provide actionable insights.
Collaborated with UX specialists to prioritise features and improve user experience.

work.name: Redgate
work.summary: Developed solutions to streamline SQL Server database deployment for users of popular release management tools.

work.name: Sungard
highlights: Contributed to a scalable framework powering a high-performance risk analytics service.
Developed a tracing just-in-time compiler, enabling C# financial models to run efficiently on GPUs.

work.name: Various

Developed a bespoke financial trading tool tailored to an independent trader's needs.

work.name: Fidelity

work.name: MathWorks

work.name: QinetiQ

work.name: Newcastle University
highlights: Conducted data analysis and modelling for a mass spectrometry experiment in Fortran.
Co-authored a peer-reviewed paper: ['Hyperfine-resolved spectrum of the molecular dication DCl²⁺'](https://journals.aps.org/pra/abstract/10.1103/PhysRevA.61.050501).
Studied mathematical modelling, numerical linear algebra, numerical optimisation and distributed computing for computational finance.
Explored the numerical solution of magnetic fluid flow in my dissertation.
Studied a wide variety of topics with an emphasis on applied mathematics, statistics and theoretical physics.
